result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott David Bohlman was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Scott David Bohlman is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Scott David Bohlman was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Penalties for Misdemeanors-Class "B"], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Evenson. ADA: Matthew L Hartung  DF ATTY: Kenneth Charles Pletcher DF: Scott David Bohlman appeared. Case called at 10:11. Includes 15CF241, 15CF245, 15CM197, 15TR1373, 15TR1374, 15TR1375,15TR1207 and 15TR1634. Court reads charge and maximum penalty. DE pleads G to Ct 1 in 15CM197 without the domestic enhancer and 15TR1373. DE sworn. Crt reviews plea questionnaire and informs DE of rights. Crt finds DE freely, voluntarily and knowingly waives rights and makes plea. Attorney's stipulate to the facts. Crt accepts plea, finds factual basis and finds DE guilty of Ct 1  in 15CM197 without the domestic enhancer and 15TR1373. On motion of the State, Crt dismisses Ct 2 in 15CM197 with prejudice. Court will dismiss Ct. 2 in 15CM197 with prejudice if there are no alcohol related offenses for one year. Set for Courts review in 1 year. Court outright dismisses 15CF245, 15CF241, 15TR1375, 15TR1634, 15TR1207 and 15TR1374 with prejudice. Sentencing arguments. DE makes statement. Crt orders:

On 15CM197 Ct. 1 Sentence W/H 
Court notes 1 day credit. 
-  $1000.00 plus Costs
-Submit DNA sample and pay surcharge.

On 15TR1373
- AODA and driver's safety plan
- 6 mo. DL revocation
  With credit for administrative suspension.
- 6 mo. IID
- $761.50 inclusive of costs  

Balance returned to payor.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Benoy     11:15   ADA:  Michael Edward Nieskes   DF ATTY:  Kenneth Charles Pletcher   DF:  Scott David Bohlman appeared.   Preliminary Hearing and Arraignment on 15CF241 & 15CF245.  STC on 15CM197, 15TR1207, 15TR1373 15TR1374, 15TR1375 & 15TR1634.  

15CF241:   Preliminary Hearing waiver signed by DF.   Court goes over rights with DF.  Court finds probable cause citing incident reports.  Court accepts waiver and binds DF over for trial.  Information has been filed. Court informs def of charges, possible penalties and rights. Def understands.  Waives reading.  NG on counts 1, 2 & 3. Waives speedy trial.  Discovery due within 20 days.  State is requesting extension for filing motions.  Motions due after the next scheduled court event.  Bond continues as to form and amount.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for November 9, 2015 at 03:30 pm.

Stipulation and Order to Modify Bond Conditions. Signed by SRN on 8/24/2015. c: DA, Fax: Atty and Jail. km

*AMENDED*

Includes case 15CF241, 15CF245 and 15CM197 

Money from all files will remain on each file at this time.  

-It is hereby ordered, as a condition of the defendant's bond/bail in the above-captioned case, that he/she have absolutely NO ABUSIVE CONTACT whatsoever with the complaining witness, or with any of the following named persons and/or locations,  Susan A. or her residence or any animals at that property.  The term "abusive contact" is hereby defined as a verbal assault or an intentional infliction of or threat to inflict physical pain, physical injury or illness, an impairment of physical condition, and /or sexual contact or sexual intercourse without consent.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.


-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- AA not less than 1 time per week and 

-Report every Tuesday, Thursday and Saturdays before 7:00pm  to the St Croix County Jail for PBT. If the DE tests positive than the DE will have UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

-Testing upon reasonable suspicion or at the Court's directive to St Croix County Jail for UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex..  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.  

- No possession of any firearms.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

- AA not less than 1 time per week and 

-Report every Tuesday, Thursday and Saturdays before 7:00pm  to the St Croix County Jail for PBT. If the DE tests positive than the DE will have UA testing, in the presence of an officer or deputy of the same sex.  If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.

If UA tests positive defendant shall submit to additional evidentiary testing to determine the use of substances forbidden by this bond agreement at the jail or Hudson Hospital.  Defendant must pay $5.00 fee at time of each test.  

- No possession of any firearms.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.

Apprs: CO: SRN, Rpr: Kasten, Clerk: Webb. ADA: Michael Edward Nieskes, DF ATTY:  Kenneth Charles Pletcher, DF:  Scott David Bohlman appeared.  Includes case 15CF241, 15CF245, 15CM197, 15TR1207, 12TR1373 15TR1374, 15TR1375 & 15TR1634.  ADA Nieskes advises the DE has gone through a treatment program.  Attorneys are working on a resolution.  ADA Nieskes wants to monitor the DE's sobriety.  No prelimins in the CF files.  Attorney Pletcher argues bond.  Attorney ADA Nieskes does not object to the No Contact being lifted.  Court refers the Victim to Victim Witness and for her to go through counseling at Turning Point.  Once Court receives a letter of proof the Victim has gone through a counseling session then bond modification for the No Contact will be considered.  UA testing is argued.  Court modifies the bonds on all files.  Set out for Preliminary Hearing on 15CF241 & 15CF245.  STC on 15CM197, 15TR1207, 15TR1373 15TR1374, 15TR1375 & 15TR1634.  Court adjourned at 9:29 a.m. lw  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 9, 2015 at 11:00 am.

The term "no contact" is hereby defined as no contact in person, by telephone, by way of electronic device, email, facsimile, through the mail, and/or through a third person.  The aforementioned condition of bond/bail is set pursuant to Sec. 969.02(3)(d), Wis Stats.

-Absolute sobriety:  Zero alcohol, zero controlled substances, zero prescribed medications (except as taken and prescribed for you by a physician) in your system, on your person, or in your possession at all times while this case is ongoing. This prohibition includes drug paraphernalia.

-Not to possess firearms.

Further, it is ORDERED that if the defendant fails to comply with the conditions of his/her bond/bail that he/she may be charged with the offense of bailjumping contrary to Sec. 946.49(1)(a), Wis. Stats.
